topic: What is Kubernetes cluster and pod?
context: A Kubernetes cluster consists of a set of worker machines, called nodes, that run containerized applications. Every cluster has at least one worker node. The worker node host the Pods that are the components of the application workload. The control plane manages the worker nodes and the Pods in the cluster. Oct 24, 2022

topic: What is a Kubernetes cluster vs node?
context: Nodes actually run the applications and workloads. The cluster is the heart of Kubernetes key advantage: the ability to schedule and run containers across a group of machines, be they physical or virtual, on premises or in the cloud. Kubernetes containers aren't tied to individual machines. Jan 15, 2020
